   $$

   $$
   \mathbf{H}_{\text{tangential}}^{\text{out}} = \mathbf{H}_{\text{tangential}}^{\text{in}}
   $$
   Since the interior of the conductor is not part of the waveguide solution, this implies:
   $$
   \mathbf{H}_{\text{tangential}}^{\text{out}} = 0
   $$
   **Thus, the tangential component of** $\boldsymbol{H}$ **is zero at the waveguide walls.**

3. **Normal Component of Magnetic Flux Density is Continuous**:

   B_{\text{normal}}^{\text{out}} = B_{\text{normal}}^{\text{in}}
